docs.text:
Information regarding Backup





Backup contains data of all telephony applications (
Baang
, 
Sawaal
, 
Polly
, and 
Rahemma
) that were deployed, using Wateen server, in three launches of 
2015
, 
2016
 and 
2017
.






 Backup Directory Structure





The backup data is in three parts, pertaining to different launches, sub-directories marked by launch year. Data means 
Database
, 
htdocs
, and 
telephony server-side scripts and configuration files 
of the particular launch.







    

        

            

                
Backup_Polly_Baang_Sawaal_2015_2016_2017
 —
                

                    root directory of backup.
                

            

    



        

            

                
2015 Launch  
 
—
                

                    data of First Launch.
                

            

    




        

            

                
2016 Launch  
 
—
                

                    data of Second Launch.
                

            

    




        

            

                
2017 Launch  
 
—
                

                    data of Third Launch.
                

            

    





            
Applications Deployed

    










  
Note :- Applications Deployed 

  

  

  
Polly
, and 
Baang
 were deployed in all three launches ( 
 2015 
, 
 2016 
 and 
 2017 
).

  
Sawaal
 was deployed in launches of 
 2016 
 and 
 2017 
.

  
Surveys
 and 
Rahemma
 were deployed in 
 2017
 only.

  
HelloRozgar
 was deployed in 
 2015
, but unlike other applications it was not stopped/monitored after that, it continued to run passively uptill now.

  



























        tree = new Treant( chart_config );
docs.title: General Info & Structure

docs.text: Backup contains data of all telephony applications ( Baang ,  Sawaal ,  Polly , and  Rahemma ) that were deployed, using Wateen server, in three launches of  2015 ,  2016  and  2017 .
docs.title: Information regarding Backup

docs.text:
The backup data is in three parts, pertaining to different launches, sub-directories marked by launch year. Data means  Database ,  htdocs , and  telephony server-side scripts and configuration files  of the particular launch.   
     
         
             
                 Backup_Polly_Baang_Sawaal_2015_2016_2017  —
                 
                    root directory of backup.
                 
             
      
         
             
                 2015 Launch     —
                 
                    data of First Launch.
                 
             
      
         
             
                 2016 Launch     —
                 
                    data of Second Launch.
                 
             
      
         
             
                 2017 Launch     —
                 
                    data of Third Launch.
                 
             
      
             Applications Deployed 
        
   Note :- Applications Deployed  
   
   
   Polly , and  Baang  were deployed in all three launches (   2015  ,   2016   and   2017  ). 
   Sawaal  was deployed in launches of   2016   and   2017  . 
   Surveys  and  Rahemma  were deployed in   2017  only. 
   HelloRozgar  was deployed in   2015 , but unlike other applications it was not stopped/monitored after that, it continued to run passively uptill now. 
            
        tree = new Treant( chart_config );
docs.title: Backup Directory Structure

docs.text:
2017 Launch


This directory contains data of 2017 launch in three sub-folders, 
Database
, 
Htdocs
 and 
FreeSWITCH
.

Applications Deployed in this launch: 
Baang
, 
Sawaal
, 
Rahemma
 and 
Polly
.

Telephony Server-Used: 
FreeSwitch
.






 Database





Databases of Polly2017, Sawaal2017, Baang2017, and Rahemma2017 in sql files are contained in this (Database) directory.





Description of Sql Files:











File                                         


Description










 baang-2017-06-30.sql


Database of Baang, contain tables such as 
userplayrectable
 , 
uservotesofrec
 ,  
recording table
 , 
feedback table
 ,  ..






 pquiz-2017-06-25.sql


Data of Sawaal, tables such as 
facts
 , 
questions
 , 
user answers
 ,  
user likes
  ..






 pollywa-2017-06-25.sql


Data of Polly, tables such as 
call table
 , 
request table
 , 
user table
 , ..






 raahemaa_test1-2017-03-01.sql


Data of Rahemma Test 1, tables such as 
feedback
 , 
files
 , 
log
 , 
prefrence






 raahemaa_test2-2017-04-21.sql


Data of Rahemma Test 2, tables such as 
feedback
 , 
log
 , 
menu_log
 , 
quiz






 raahemaa_test3-2017-05-31.sql


Data of Rahemma Test 3, tables such as 
actions
 , 
calls
 , 
cost
 , 
doctor_tip
, ..






 raahemaa_test4-2017-06-25.sql


Data of Rahemma Test 4, tables such as 
action
 , 
case_answer
 , 
logs
 , 
question
, ..






 pollywasys-2017-06-30.sql


Phone-number to encoded-key mapping data, 
phkey table
 , of users in deployed applications, Baang and Polly in 2016 launch.










The 
'2017-06-25'
 sub-string in names of sql files represents the date 
2017-06-25
 on which the application launch is cluminated.  







 Htdocs





Web root of HTTP server.





Description of important Folders, it contains:











Folder                                         


Description










 Baang


Baang code scripts and recording data.






 BaangMonitor


Baang monitor scripts.






 FS


Seperate Master code scripts, 
APollyLHR.php
, 
APQuizLHR.php
, 
ABaangLHR.php
, 
ARemLHR.php
, controls user's interaction in calls for deployed applications. It controls calls through Native communication with FreeSWITCH, over the event socket interface.






 Hellorozgar


Hellorozgar monitor scripts.






 PollyMonitorWA


Polly monitor scripts.






 PQuiz


Sawaal code scripts and recording data.






 PQuizMonitor


Sawaal monitor scripts.






 REMT1


Rahemaa Test 1 dashboard scripts.






 REMT2


Rahemaa Test 2 API and dashboard scripts.






 REMT3


Rahemaa Test 3 API and dashboard scripts.






 REMT4


Rahemaa Test 4 API and dashboard API and dashboard scripts.






 survey


Survey, launched on polly, scripts.






 Survey_Audios


Audios used in Survey.






 survey_new


Survey, launched on polly and Baang, scripts.






 wa


Audio-editing Praat scripts , Call-logs of all deployed applications 
 Qlogs.rar
  , and Polly code scripts and recording data.











 FreeSWITCH





Telephony server Root Directory.

It contains three sub-folder namely 
conf
, 
scripts
 and 
logs
. 





 conf





Configuration Files of FreeSWITCH. 
Important config file/folders are: 
vars.xml
 , 
autoload_configs
 , 
dialplan
 and 
sip_profiles
.





 
vars.xml


System wide variables. Default configurations such as default port and password of FreeSWITCH.


Default Password must be Changed

The default password of FreeSWITCH is defined in:  


<X-PRE-PROCESS cmd="set" data="default_password=Conakry2014"/>







 
autoload_configs
 
  





Configuration files which loaded automatically into FreeSWITCH and contain configuration information for core modules.  


Main config files used are: 
 
modules.conf.xml
 and 
 
sofia.conf.xml
.  





modules.conf.xml
 tells FreeSWITCH which modules to load.  





sofia.conf.xml
 contains a 
"X-PRE-PROCESS"
 directive that includes other XML files (within, by default, conf/sip_profiles/) that define one or more 
"SIP Profiles"
.  





 
dialplan
 
  





XML-based call-routing mechanism. It route dialed/received call to its appropriate endpoint, which is an extension specific to deployed IVR Application. Extensions invokes appropiate Lua script , for example on receiving call invokes IncomingHook.lua, in 
scripts folder 
FreeSwitch/scripts

public.xml:
This contains configurations for handling calls coming in to FreeSWITCH.  





Dialplans configuration is mainly contained in two files: 
default.xml
  and 
public.xml
 , representing default and public context for handling call requests.  





default.xml
 primary FreeSWITCH Dialplan configuration. 





public.xml
 contains configurations, extensions defined for deployed IVR Applications, for handling calls coming in to FreeSWITCH.





As per default the contexts are called "Public" and "Default".

Everything in the public context is available to everyone, while everything in "default" context are only available to users that have registered with FreeSWITCH. You can define in the user profiles (in the directory) which context they belong to, and you can define the public context in the sofia configuration.





 
sip_profiles
 
  





SIP Profiles allow you to define paths to devices or carriers that may live inside or outside your network. A SIP Profile is a SIP UA (User Agent or an endpoint), which communicates with other SIP endpoints.





Files of Sip Profiles used are: 
internal.xml
 and 
external.xml
 , representing internal and external sip-profiles.  





internal.xml
 represent the Internal sip_profile, and is used to communicate with devices on local network.





external.xml
 represent the External sip_profile, and is used to communicate with 
wateen gateway
, service provider.





 scripts





Defined as default scripts directory. It contains Lua Scripts which enables IVR Applications ( Baang, Sawaal and Polly ) Master code script to handle incoming\outgoing calls.

Master code script hosted on local XAMP server.





IVR Applications connects to the FreeSWITCH server on the port 8021 (TCP Socket Connection, pass= 
'Conakry2014'
) and sends api commands invoking relevant lua scripts, which render and respond back appropiately to application. 





Freeswitch extensions invoke lua scripts that in turn invoke the master code script, for event notification and call control intiation according to different IVR application. For example. FreeSWITCH notify Baang IVR application using 
IncomingHook.lua
, when Baang User make an inbound call.





Using Socket Connections, IVR Applications can 
:








check status  
 isActive.lua
 


make outbound calls, for Polly 
 call.lua
 , for Baang 
call_baang.lua
 , for PQuiz 
 call_pquiz.lua
 , for Rahemaa 
 call_rem.lua
 


answer incoming calls  
 answer.lua


hang up a call  
 hangup.lua


reject a call  
 reject.lua
 


record user voice  
 record.lua


play sound files  
 ask.lua
 


play with gather input  
 askGather.lua
. 









 logs





 cdr_logs.csv

 having Call Data Records (CDR) logs of calls like calls times and durations.




























        tree = new Treant( chart_config );

Configuration Files of FreeSWITCH.

Main config files used are:    modules.conf.xml  and    sofia.conf.xml .     modules.conf.xml  tells FreeSWITCH which modules to load.     sofia.conf.xml  contains a  "X-PRE-PROCESS"  directive that includes other XML files (within, by default, conf/sip_profiles/) that define one or more  "SIP Profiles" .       dialplan        XML-based call-routing mechanism. It route dialed/received call to its appropriate endpoint, which is an extension specific to deployed IVR Application. Extensions invokes appropiate Lua script , for example on receiving call invokes IncomingHook.lua, in  scripts folder  FreeSwitch/scripts 
public.xml:
This contains configurations for handling calls coming in to FreeSWITCH.     Dialplans configuration is mainly contained in two files:  default.xml   and  public.xml  , representing default and public context for handling call requests.     default.xml  primary FreeSWITCH Dialplan configuration.    public.xml  contains configurations, extensions defined for deployed IVR Applications, for handling calls coming in to FreeSWITCH.   As per default the contexts are called "Public" and "Default". 
Everything in the public context is available to everyone, while everything in "default" context are only available to users that have registered with FreeSWITCH. You can define in the user profiles (in the directory) which context they belong to, and you can define the public context in the sofia configuration.     sip_profiles        SIP Profiles allow you to define paths to devices or carriers that may live inside or outside your network. A SIP Profile is a SIP UA (User Agent or an endpoint), which communicates with other SIP endpoints. Defined as default scripts directory. It contains Lua Scripts which enables IVR Applications ( Baang, Sawaal and Polly ) Master code script to handle incoming\outgoing calls. 
Master code script hosted on local XAMP server.   IVR Applications connects to the FreeSWITCH server on the port 8021 (TCP Socket Connection, pass=  'Conakry2014' ) and sends api commands invoking relevant lua scripts, which render and respond back appropiately to application.    Freeswitch extensions invoke lua scripts that in turn invoke the master code script, for event notification and call control intiation according to different IVR application. For example. FreeSWITCH notify Baang IVR application using  IncomingHook.lua , when Baang User make an inbound call.   Using Socket Connections, IVR Applications can  :     check status    isActive.lua    make outbound calls, for Polly   call.lua  , for Baang  call_baang.lua  , for PQuiz   call_pquiz.lua  , for Rahemaa   call_rem.lua    answer incoming calls    answer.lua  hang up a call    hangup.lua  reject a call    reject.lua    record user voice    record.lua  play sound files    ask.lua    play with gather input    askGather.lua .

docs.text:
2016 Launch


This directory contains data of 2016 launch in three sub-folders, 
Database
, 
Htdocs
 and 
FreeSWITCH
.

Applications Deployed in this launch: 
Baang
, 
Sawaal
, and 
Polly
.

Telephony Server-Used: 
FreeSwitch
.






 Database





Databases of Polly2016, Sawaal2016, and Baang2016 in sql files are contained in this (Database) directory.





Description of Sql Files:











File                                         


Description










 baang-2016-02-25.sql


Database of Baang, contain tables such as 
userplayrectable
 , 
uservotesofrec
 ,  
recording table
 , 
feedback table
 ,  ..






 pquiz-2016-02-25.sql


Data of Sawaal, tables such as 
facts
 , 
questions
 , 
user answers
 ,  
user likes
  ..






 pollywa-2016-02-25.sql


Data of Polly, tables such as 
call table
 , 
request table
 , 
user table
 , ..






 pollywasys-2016-02-25.sql


Phone-number to encoded-key mapping data, 
phkey table
 , of users in deployed applications, Sawaal, Baang and Polly in 2016 launch.










The 
'2016-02-25'
 sub-string in names of sql files represents the date 
2016-02-25
 on which the application launch is cluminated.  







 Htdocs





Web root of HTTP server.





Description of important Folders, it contains:











Folder                                         


Description










 Baang


Baang code scripts and recording data.






 BaangMonitor


Baang monitor scripts.






 FS


Master code scripts, 
APollyLHR.php
, controls user's interaction in calls for deployed applications. It controls calls through Native communication with FreeSWITCH, over the event socket interface.






 PollyMonitorWA


Polly monitor scripts.






 PQuiz


Sawaal code scripts and recording data.






 PQuizMonitor


Sawaal monitor scripts.






 wa


Audio-editing Praat scripts , Call-logs of all deployed applications 
 Qlogs.rar
  , and Polly code scripts and recording data.











 FreeSWITCH





Telephony server Root Directory.

It contains three sub-folder namely 
conf
, 
scripts
 and 
logs
. 





 conf





Configuration Files of FreeSWITCH.

Important config file/folders are: 
vars.xml
 , 
autoload_configs
 , 
dialplan
 and 
sip_profiles
.

Configuration files are same as is defined in 2017 Launch/FreeSwitch/conf/.

Only 
dialplan\public.xml
 is different with added extensions defined, for Rahemma Application.  





 scripts





Scripts are same as is defined in 2017 Launch/FreeSwitch/scripts/.

The difference is that in 2016 only [
call.lua(https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B2rhATWIcB9BZ3BJMTQyaGV5dmc) script is used to make outbound calls for all applications while in 2017 sperate calling script for each applicaiton was defined.  


Hence, it does not contain call_baang, call_pquiz and call_rem. 





 logs





cdr_logs.csv having Call Data Records (CDR) logs of calls like calls times and durations.




























        tree = new Treant( chart_config );

Database
,

 and

.
